body.p: Plugin command to initialize a storage plugin for the restore operation.

section.title: Description
section.p: gprestore invokes the setup_plugin_for_restore plugin command on the master and all segment hosts during gprestore initialization phase.

The setup_plugin_for_restore command should perform the activities necessary to initialize the remote storage system before a restore operation begins. Set up activities may include creating remote directories, validating connectivity to the remote storage system, etc.

plentry.pd: The absolute path to the plugin configuration YAML file.
The local directory on the Greenplum Database host (master and segments) from which gprestore reads backup files. gprestore creates this local directory.

The execution scope (host or segment instance) for the plugin. Specify one of these values to execute the plugin based on the Greenplun Database configuration when the back up started.
master - Execute the plugin once on the master host.
segment_host - Execute the plugin once on the segment hosts.
segment - Execute the plugin on the segment hosts, once for each active segment instance.
For example, you run the command twice, specifying the scope master and then segment_host to run the plugin once on all the Greenplum Database hosts.

section.title: Exit Code
section.p: The setup_plugin_for_restore command must exit with a value of 0 on success, non-zero if an error occurs. In the case of a non-zero exit code, gprestore displays the contents of stderr to the user.
